div.p: The ensemble of the annually averaged positions of the 15 °C isotherm at 200 m depth (GSNW) for each year (1965–2004: grey lines; 2005–2017: dotted magenta lines), five decadal-annual positions of the GSNW (five colored lines), and the 1965–2017 average GSNW position (bold blue line). The 10 °C isotherm at 200 m depth (blue dotted line) illustrates the North Atlantic Current veering northward from the GSNW branch that aligns with the Azores Current (see the scheme in Fig. 1). The standard deviations (degrees of latitude) are shown by bars with numbers in the insert together with decadal-annual positions of the GSNW (five bold colored lines).
